Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, both the interior and exterior are very worn, faint traces of one line of Coptic text written in black ink survive on the exterior.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394343) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394343)
